page.title: 18THE DARENTH TAVERN
page.content: The{Darenth Tavern}(formerly the White Hart) is based around a public house but its facilities have been extended to include meals, music, dancing, pool and other attractions. It is licenced for 300 people and employs 24 staff on a rota basis. It was built in 1926 over existing cellars. Two major forms of fermented prod- ucts are kept in a chilled cellar (55C). 'Traditional' beer still contains yeast and has to be allowed to settle out. 'Keg' beers, lagers and ciders have been pasteurised and produce no sediment. The Kilderkins (18 gals.) of traditional ale are placed on end and the beer drawn up to the bar through a spear which can be placed at different levels. Keg products are driven up by gas. Opening times: 10a.m.-3p.m. 6p.m.-mid.
